intro: Daucus broteri var. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored carrot, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its bi-colored flowers, typically white and purple, which bloom in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of the common carrot. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the island's unique climate.
